name: Exo Simulation
description:
[English] [Fançais sur le site internet]

Exo Simulation ( previously named A God’s job ) is a universe simulation video game that includes elements of management and exploration.

It is a pc game under windows (other platforms are possible but not currently scheduled).

You have the opportunity to explore a galaxy filled with thousands of unique stars, each with more or less habitable planets. You will have to find worlds that are able to support to life or close enough for life to grow.

You can gather resources to improve your space ship, your resource extraction tools and build many objects to terraform a planet.

A laboratory is available to the player to make it able to create or evolve life forms to make them survive on specific conditions. You can save life in the form of samples that can be used on a planet. Life forms evolved in the laboratory can survive and develop where naturally there can be no life (too hot, too cold, too much radiation…).

There are two game modes, the sandbox mode, allowing the player to have complete freedom of action, and the history mode that adds difficulty to the game with the management of resources, the ship and much more. The history mode will offer to the player a complex and intriguing history that combines exploration, discoveries and puzzles.

The game can be modified with mods to add different forms of life, modify the galaxy, star systems and much more!

The game is in English or French but can be easily translated into any languages and will be with updates.

The game is in early access, it's mean bugs, missing features and pictures. Your save can be lost sometimes with updates. I'm working alone on this project since two years, community's feedbacks will be used to improve the gameplay and the game itself.
